intro: Metrosideros rugulosa, commonly known as the rough bark kōwhai, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive rough, fissured bark and bright red flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in coastal and lowland areas. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a leathery texture, while its flowers are clustered and appear in spring. The rough bark kōwhai plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native birds and insects.
